summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Ghislaine Maxwell by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding her to appear on July 24, 2020, to testify and produce foreign financial account records (FBAR-related documents) for the past five years. The subpoena relates to alleged violations of foreign bank account reporting laws.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document is a grand jury subpoena addressed to her, commanding her appearance and production of foreign financial account records.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Listed as the attorney for service of the subpoena to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss

connections.description: Christian Everdell is listed as the attorney for service of the subpoena to Ghislaine Maxwell.
Audrey Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority issuing the grand jury subpoena to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is commanded to appear before a federal grand jury in New York to testify and produce foreign financial account records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued and signed by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Ghislaine Maxwell on July 1, 2020, for her appearance on July 24, 2020.
The subpoena commands Maxwell to testify and produce records related to foreign financial accounts (FBAR records) for the past five years.
The alleged violations cited are 31 U.S.C. §§ 5314 and 5322(a)-(b) and 31 C.F.R. § 1010.420, which govern reporting of foreign bank and financial accounts.
The subpoena indicates an active financial investigation into Maxwell's foreign accounts by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
